content: like this method break yarn the best leaving a long http //www knittingatknoon com/provisional html tail but you can use whatever method you like beginning at row 1 rs k the inside edge slip cast on the following row will form one complete wedge stitches onto second needle row 2 ws k to 2 sts from end w+t and remove row 3 k to end waste yarn row 4 k to 1 st from gap w+t repeat last 2 row 1 2 3 times to maintain the garter stitch pattern graft stitches there are 3 4 5 wrapped stitches at inner narrower together with working yarn as follows edge step 1 insert needle into first stitch on front needle as from back to front as if to purl step 2 insert needle into first stitch on back needle from front to back as if to knit drop stitch off needle step 3 insert needle into first stitch on back needle from back to front as if to purl step 4 insert needle into first stitch on front needle from front to back as if to knit drop stitch off needle repeat these 4 steps until all stitches have been worked alternatively join stitches with a 3 needle bind off worked from the crown using a spare needle this won t be quite as invisible as the grafting but is easier row 7 9 11 k to 4 sts from end w+t and faster to work row 8 10 12 k to 1 st from gap w+t repeat last row 8 times weave yarn through stitches around centre and pull tight to close up hole weave in ends there are 8 9 10 wrapped stitches at inner edge and 5 at outer wider edge the outer edge will form part optional make stalk by pulling a short loop of yarn of the band of the hat through to the right side at the centre of crown and rub together with damp fingertips to felt row 17 19 21 k across all sts ignoring wraps row 18 20 22 ws k across all sts ignoring wraps row 19 21 23 rs sl1 k to end repeat from row 2 to end 7 times omitting last 2 row of final wedge there are a total of 8 connected wedges
